newsitem.title: BELGIUM: W.Europe car registrations down 3.0pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: W.Europe car registrations down 3.0pct yr/yr.

text.p: car registrations fell three percent year-on-year in March, with 1,241,100 units recorded for the month, the European car manufacturers' association ACEA said in a news statement.

Volkswagen, posting no growth, nevertheless headed the table of market share, followed by Fiat and the grouped figures for Japanese manufacturers, ACEA said. Those three showed market shares of 17.2 percent, 12.8 percent and 12.6 percent respectively.
GM Group came next, with 11.9 percent, followed by the PSA Group, comprising Peugeot and Citroen, with 11.2 percent, the Ford Group with 11.1 percent and Renault with 9.6 percent.
The table also figured BMW Group's six percent share, Mercedes's 3.4 percent, Volvo 1.8 percent and the 1.8 percent amalgamated figures for Korean manufacturers.
